result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on March 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Exhibit 1 TIME driver record report filed by Atty Lippert filed in the 2022 Criminal/Traffic Evidence files

3:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher W. Gogert in court. Attorney John Holevoet appeared on behalf of Attorney Sasa G Johnen in court for Christopher W. Gogert. State called Lieutenant Roger Witthun from the Columbus Police Department, sworn 3:32 pm. Testimony taken, 3:47 pm witness excused. Exhibit 1 marked by Atty Lippert, TIME driver report (doc #11 ) moved into evidence, received. State request bindover. Defense objects. Court found probable case, bound over. Information filed, waived reading. Defendant stands mute. Not guilty plea entered, will set for trial. 3:49 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm
